Algebraic sum of axial thicknesses from surface "i" to surface "j"

Physical length from surface "i" to surface "j" along a path connecting surface vertices and ignoring tilts and decentrations. This is the sum of the axial thicknesses multiplied by the refractive index in each space.

Edge thickness from surface "i" to surface "i"+1. Surface tilts and decentrations are ignored. If clear apertures are assigned, they are assumed circular with the YZ-plane value being used. The larger of the values on surface "i" and "i"+1 is used. If no clear apertures are assigned, then the larger of the sums of PY+PCY on surfaces "i" and "i"+1 are used in the calculation. Clear aperture decentrations and tilts are ignored.

Edge thickness from surface "i" to surface "i"+1. Surface tilts and decentrations are ignored. If clear apertures are assigned, they are assumed circular with the XZ-plane value being used. The larger of the values on surface "i" and "i"+1 is used. If no clear apertures are assigned, then the larger of the sums of PX+PCX on surfaces "i" and "i"+1 are used in the calculation. Clear aperture decentrations and tilts are ignored.
Any one of the 96 coefficients of a special surface attached to surface "i"

Y-alternate pivot point at surface "i"
Z-alternate pivot point at surface "I"
X-dimension of the clear aperture height at surface "I". Zero is returned if no clear aperture is assigned.
Y-dimension of the clear aperture height at surface "I". Zero is returned if no clear aperture is assigned.
diffraction grating spacing

MASS in Kgs of elements from surface "i" to surface "j". This calculation assumes spherical surfaces and ignores all decenters and tilts. It uses the specific gravity assigned to surfaces with the lens database command "SPGR".
Cost in cost units based upon a WEIGHT calculation multiplied by the individual surface price/Kg values stored in the lens database.
The actuator value between –1.0 and 1.0 for actuator "j" on surface "i" if surface "i" is defined as a deformable surface.
Returns the maximun actuator value on surface "i" if surface "i" is defined as a deformable surface.
Returns the minumum actuator value on surface "i" if surface "i" is defined as a deformable surface.
Returns the average of all active actuator values on surface "i" if surface "i" is defined as a deformable surface.
Returns the standard deviation from the mean of all active actuator values on surface "i" if surface "i" is defined as a deformable surface.
Returns the peak to valley value for all active actuator values on surface "i" if surface "i" is defined as a deformable surface.
